table.name: DIM_APPLICATIONS
table.description:
A Dimension table to filter measures according to Application Tags. The COLUMN names depend on the end-user categories. We give an example here based on the demo site: ``` COLUMN | TYPE | DESCRIPTION ------------------------------+----------+------------ application_name | INT | Table primary key "Age" | TEXT | A range of ages of the application "Business Unit" | TEXT | The Business Unit as a sponsor or provider of the application "Country" | TEXT | The deployment country of the application "Release Frequency" | TEXT | The release frequency of the application "Sourcing" | TEXT | The out sourcing company "Methodology" | TEXT | The application development approach ```
Note: if you need these column names to be converted into lowercase identifiers with no space character, and with no double-quotes delimiters, then set the environment variable QUOTED_IDENTIFIER=OFF

table.name: DIM_QUALITY_STANDARDS
table.description:
A Dimension view to filter measures according to Quality Standards. * in case of a data extraction from a central base, the Quality Standard extension version must be __20181030__ or higher; it is recommended to install the __20190923__ version or higher to get the ISO standards * in case of a data extraction from a measurement base, the measurement base must be __8.3.5__ or higher
This view can be customized in order to extend the columns, by editing the SQL script: ```views/DIM_QUALITY_STANDARDS.sql``` See the STD_DESCRIPTIONS and STD_RULES tables to get the available quality standard tags. By default the following BOOLEAN columns are defined: ``` COLUMN | TYPE | DESCRIPTION -------------------------------------+----------+------------ metric_id | INT | AIP Globally unique metric ID rule_name | TEXT | Rule name aip_top_priority | BOOLEAN | Check whether this rule is a top priority rule according to AIP cwe | BOOLEAN | Check whether this rule detects a CWE weakness omg_ascqm | BOOLEAN | Check whether this rule detects ISO weakness owasp_2017 | BOOLEAN | Check whether this rule detects a top 10 OWASP 2017 vulnerability ```

table.name: DIM_SNAPSHOTS
table.description: A Dimension table to filter measures according to a period. * Column YEAR, YEAR_MONTH, YEAR_QUARTER, YEAR_WEEK are set only for the most recent snapshot of this period for this application; they are provided to filter snapshots for a specific period * These columns make sense when applications are periodically analyzed. For instance, if each application is analyzed once a year, then we can use the column YEAR as a filter; if some applications are not analyzed every week; then the YEAR_WEEK filter must be used carefully.

column.name: snapshot_id
column.description: The concatenation of the application name and the snapshot timestamp

column.name: date
column.description: The snapshot capture date (ie the user input date) without timezone

column.name: is_latest
column.description: Check whether this is the latest snapshot of this application

column.name: year
column.description: Tag the most recent application snapshot for each year (ex format: 2017-Q3)

column.name: year_quarter
column.description: Tag the most recent application snapshot for each quarter (ex format: 2017-Q3)

column.name: year_month
column.description: Tag the most recent application snapshot for each month (ex format: 2017-04)

column.name: year_week
column.description: Tag the most recent application snapshot for each week (ex format: 2017-W24)

column.name: consolidation_mode
column.description: Consolidation mode when application score is based on modules scores; otherwise "Full Application"

column.name: internal_id
column.description: RESERVED - Do not use - Local Snapshot ID (use with cautious as this ID depends on the schema type: measurement/central). Use preferably snapshot_id column, or snapshot_number column. Do not use to order snapshots.

table.name: DIM_RULES
table.description: A dimension table to filter measures according to rules contribution. * Each row is a rule definition from the Assessment Model of the latest snapshot according to the 'functional/capture date' of each application , when a score exists for this application snapshot. * The list of Business Criteria is closed. no custom business criteria are taken into account. * In case of a rule with multiple technical criteria contributions, we select the contribution with the highest impact on grades considering the critical attribute and the weight attribute.

column.name: rule_id
column.description: Local rule ID is the concatenation of the application name and the AIP Globally unique metric ID

column.name: business_criterion_id
column.description: The Business Criterion name of the highest contribution weight for this rule

column.name: business_criterion_name
column.description: The Business Criterion ID of the highest contribution weight for this rule

column.name: technical_criterion_weight
column.description: Highest weight contribution to the Business Criteria

column.name: technical_criterion_id
column.description: The Technical Criterion ID of the highest contribution weight for this rule

column.name: technical_criterion_name
column.description: The Technical Criterion name of the highest contribution weight for this rule

column.name: is_critical
column.description: true if at least there is one critical contribution to a technical criterion

column.name: weight
column.description: Highest weight contribution to the Technical Criteria

column.name: weight_architectural_design
column.description: Contribution weight of the technical criterion. 0 if no contribution

column.name: weight_changeability
column.description: Contribution weight of the technical criterion. 0 if no contribution

column.name: weight_documentation
column.description: Contribution weight of the technical criterion. 0 if no contribution

column.name: weight_efficiency
column.description: Contribution weight of the technical criterion. 0 if no contribution

column.name: weight_maintainability
column.description: Contribution weight of the technical criterion. 0 if no contribution

column.name: weight_programming_practices
column.description: Contribution weight of the technical criterion. 0 if no contribution

column.name: weight_robustness
column.description: Contribution weight of the technical criterion. 0 if no contribution

column.name: weight_security
column.description: Contribution weight of the technical criterion. 0 if no contribution

column.name: weight_total_quality_index
column.description: Contribution weight of the technical criterion. 0 if no contribution

column.name: weight_transferability
column.description: Contribution weight of the technical criterion. 0 if no contribution

table.name: DIM_OMG_RULES
table.description: A dimension table to filter measures according to rules contribution to ISO index * Each row is a rule definition from the Assessment Model of the latest snapshot according to the 'functional/capture date' of each application , when a score exists for this application snapshot. * In case of a rule with multiple technical criteria contributions, we select the contribution with the highest impact on grades considering the critical attribute and the weight attribute.

column.name: rule_id
column.description: Local rule ID is the concatenation of the application name and the AIP Globally unique metric ID

column.name: technical_criterion_name
column.description: The Technical Criterion name of the highest contribution weight for this rule

column.name: is_critical
column.description: true if at least there is one critical contribution to a technical criterion

column.name: weight
column.description: Highest weight contribution to the technical criteria

column.name: weight_omg_maintainability
column.description: Contribution weight of the ISO technical criterion. 0 if no contribution

column.name: weight_omg_efficiency
column.description: Contribution weight of the ISO technical criterion. 0 if no contribution

column.name: weight_omg_reliability
column.description: Contribution weight of the ISO technical criterion. 0 if no contribution

column.name: weight_omg_security
column.description: Contribution weight of the ISO technical criterion. 0 if no contribution

column.name: weight_omg_index
column.description: Contribution weight of the ISO technical criterion. 0 if no contribution

table.name: DIM_CISQ_RULES
table.description: A dimension table to filter measures according to rules contribution to CISQ index * Each row is a rule definition from the Assessment Model of the latest snapshot according to the 'functional/capture date' of each application , when a score exists for this application snapshot. * In case of a rule with multiple technical criteria contributions, we select the contribution with the highest impact on grades considering the critical attribute and the weight attribute.

column.name: rule_id
column.description: Local rule ID is the concatenation of the application name and the AIP Globally unique metric ID

column.name: technical_criterion_name
column.description: The Technical Criterion name of the highest contribution weight for this rule

column.name: is_critical
column.description: true if at least there is one critical contribution to a technical criterion

column.name: weight
column.description: Highest weight contribution to the technical criteria

column.name: weight_cisq_maintainability
column.description: Contribution weight of the technical criterion. 0 if no contribution

column.name: weight_cisq_efficiency
column.description: Contribution weight of the technical criterion. 0 if no contribution

column.name: weight_cisq_reliability
column.description: Contribution weight of the technical criterion. 0 if no contribution

column.name: weight_cisq_security
column.description: Contribution weight of the technical criterion. 0 if no contribution

column.name: weight_cisq_index
column.description: Contribution weight of the technical criterion. 0 if no contribution

table.name: APP_VIOLATIONS_MEASURES
table.description: Violation ratio by application snapshot, by technology, by rule. We extract measures for rules that are still active in the latest snapshot of each application. If for some reasons a rule has been deactivated or detached for an application, no measure are extracted for this application.

column.name: snapshot_id
column.description: The concatenation of the application name and the snapshot timestamp

column.name: rule_id
column.description: Local rule ID is the concatenation of the application name and the AIP Globally unique metric ID

column.name: violation_ratio
column.description: The value of number of violations divided by the number of checked objects

table.name: APP_FINDINGS_MEASURES
table.description: Count of violations findings for the most recent snapshot only. Skip rules that have been deactivated or detached.

column.name: snapshot_id
column.description: The concatenation of the application name and the snapshot timestamp

column.name: rule_id
column.description: Local rule ID is the concatenation of the application name and the AIP Globally unique metric ID

column.name: nb_findings
column.description: Total number of findings associated to this rule ; for example the number of bookmarks, number of paths, number of objects

table.name: APP_VIOLATIONS_EVOLUTION
table.description: Added and removed violation numbers by application snapshot, by technology, by rule. We extract measures for rules that are still active in the latest snapshot of each application. If for some reasons a rule has been deactivated or detached for an application, no measure are extracted for this application. Some rules may be not reported if both nb_added_violations and nb_removed_violations equal zero.

column.name: snapshot_id
column.description: The concatenation of the application name and the snapshot timestamp

column.name: previous_snapshot_id
column.description: The concatenation of the application name and the snapshot timestamp

column.name: rule_id
column.description: Local rule ID is the concatenation of the application name and the AIP Globally unique metric ID

table.name: APP_SIZING_MEASURES
table.description: Sizes by application snapshot.

column.name: snapshot_id
column.description: The concatenation of the application name and the snapshot timestamp

column.name: nb_commented_out_code_lines
column.description: (Metric #10109) Total number of code comment lines

column.name: nb_complexity_very_high
column.description: (Metric #67002) Total number of artifacts with a very high cost complexity

column.name: nb_complexity_high
column.description: (Metric #67003) Total number of artifacts with a high cost complexity

column.name: nb_complexity_medium
column.description: (Metric #67004) Total number of artifacts with a medium cost complexity

column.name: nb_complexity_low
column.description: (Metric #67005) Total number of artifacts with a low cost complexity

column.name: nb_cyclomatic_very_high
column.description: (Metric #65505) Total number of artifacts with a very high cyclomatic complexity

column.name: nb_cyclomatic_high
column.description: (Metric #65504) Total number of artifacts with a high cyclomatic complexity

column.name: nb_cyclomatic_medium
column.description: (Metric #65503) Total number of artifacts with a medium cyclomatic complexity

column.name: nb_cyclomatic_low
column.description: (Metric #65502) Total number of artifacts with a low cyclomatic complexity

column.name: nb_violations_fixed_action_plan
column.description: (Metric #67217) Total number of fixed violations for action plan

column.name: nb_violations_pending_action_plan
column.description: (Metric #67216) Total number of pending violations in action plan

column.name: technical_debt_density
column.description: (Metric #68002) Technical Debt density estimates the cost per thousand of lines of code to fix a pre-set percentage of high severity violations, of medium severity violations, and of low severity violations

column.name: technical_debt_total
column.description: (Metric #68001) Technical Debt estimates the cost to fix a pre-set percentage of high severity violations, of medium severity violations, and of low severity violations

table.name: MOD_VIOLATIONS_MEASURES
table.description: Violation ratio by snapshot, by module and by technology, by rule. We extract measures for rules that are still active in the latest snapshot of each application. If for some reasons a rule has been deactivated or detached for an application, no measure are extracted for this application.

column.name: snapshot_id
column.description: The concatenation of the application name and the snapshot timestamp

column.name: rule_id
column.description: Local rule ID is the concatenation of local snapshot ID and the external rule ID

column.name: violation_ratio
column.description: The value of number of violations divided by the number of checked objects

table.name: MOD_VIOLATIONS_EVOLUTION
table.description: Added and removed violation numbers by snapshot, by module, by technology, by rule. We extract measures for rules that are still active in the latest snapshot of each application. If for some reasons a rule has been deactivated or detached for an application, no measure are extracted for this application. Some rules may be not reported if both nb_added_violations and nb_removed_violations equal zero.

column.description: The concatenation of the application name and the snapshot timestamp

column.name: rule_id
column.description: Local rule ID is the concatenation of the application name and the AIP Globally unique metric ID

column.description: Business Criterion Name (Total Quality Index, Security, etc.)

table.name: STD_RULES
table.description: Mapping of Rules with Quality Standards references

table.name: STD_DESCRIPTIONS
table.description: Descriptions of Quality Standards references

column.name: standard
column.description: Standard name (it may include a version number)

column.name: category
column.description: A category of the standard or a standard version name

column.name: title
column.description: Title or short description of the reference

table.name: SRC_HEALTH_IMPACTS
table.description: Propagated Risk Index, and Risk Propagation Factor by Business Criterion and Source Object for the latest snapshot of each application

column.name: snapshot_id
column.description: The concatenation of the application name and the snapshot timestamp

column.name: object_id
column.description: Concatenation of application name and object internal unique ID from central Base

column.name: nb_violated_rules
column.description: Number of violated rules impacting the business criterion

column.name: nb_violations
column.description: Number of violations impacting the business criterion

column.name: propagated_risk_index
column.description: Propagated Risk Index (PRI) is a measurement of a risk for an object and a business criterion

column.name: risk_propagation_factor
column.description: The number of different call paths to reach the critical violations

table.name: SRC_OBJECTS
table.description: Source objects details

column.name: object_id
column.description: Concatenation of application name and object internal unique ID from central Base

column.name: object_status
column.description: Object status regarding the latest snapshot: added, updated, unchanged

column.name: action_planned
column.description: An action has been planned for this object, see USR_ACTION_PLAN for more details

column.name: is_artifact
column.description: A source object on which a cost complexity can be calculated

column.name: complexityity
column.description: This value is valid if IS_ARTIFACT if column is true Cost complexity (-1: n/a, 0:low, 1:medium, 2:high, 3:very-high) is a risk assessment calculated from risk assessments of - Cyclomatic complexity - SQL cyclomatic complexity - Granularity - Lack of comments

table.name: SRC_MOD_OBJECTS
table.description: Source objects of applications by module

column.name: object_id
column.description: Concatenation of application name and object internal unique ID from central Base

table.name: SRC_TRANSACTIONS
table.description: Transactions details. A transaction is a clone of the entry point source object

column.name: trx_id
column.description: Concatenation of application name and object internal unique ID from central Base

column.name: trx_status
column.description: Transaction status regarding the latest snapshot: added, updated, unchanged. The status is 'updated' when a source object member has been updated

table.name: SRC_TRX_OBJECTS
table.description: Source objects of transactions

column.name: trx_id
column.description: The transaction ID from the SRC_TRANSACTIONS table

column.name: object_id
column.description: The source object ID, member of the transaction from the SRC_OBJECTS table

table.name: SRC_TRX_HEALTH_IMPACTS
table.description: Transaction Risk Indexes for the 2 latest snapshots

column.name: trx_id
column.description: Concatenation of application name and object internal unique ID from central Base.

column.name: snapshot_id
column.description: The concatenation of the application name and the snapshot timestamp

column.name: security_risk_index
column.description: Transaction Risk Index (TRI) for Security health factor

column.name: efficiency_risk_index
column.description: Transaction Risk Index (TRI) for Efficiency health factor

column.name: robustness_risk_index
column.description: Transaction Risk Index (TRI) for Robustness health factor

table.name: SRC_VIOLATIONS
table.description: Violations for the 2 latest snapshots of each application of a central base

column.name: snapshot_id
column.description: The concatenation of the application name and the snapshot timestamp

column.name: rule_id
column.description: Local rule ID is the concatenation of the application name and the AIP Globally unique metric ID

column.name: finding_name
column.description: Also known as the "Associated Value Name"

column.name: nb_findings
column.description: Number of findings associated to this violation ; for example the number of bookmarks, number of paths, number of objects

table.name: USR_ACTION_PLAN
table.description: Users Requests to remediate violations. Note that a violation can be solved and raised again. Deactivated rules are not reported.

column.name: rule_id
column.description: Key. Local rule ID is the concatenation of the application name and the AIP Globally unique metric ID

column.name: object_id
column.description: Concatenation of application name and object internal unique ID from central Base

column.name: action_status
column.description: Status regarding the latest snapshot: added, pending, solved (ie fixed)

column.name: start_date
column.description: The creation date of the action plan issue

column.name: end_date
column.description: The resolution date of the action plan issue

column.name: user_name
column.description: The author of the action plan issue

table.name: USR_EXCLUSIONS
table.description: Users Requests to discard some violations identified as false positive, for next snapshots

column.name: rule_id
column.description: Local rule ID is the concatenation of the application name and the AIP Globally unique metric ID

column.name: object_id
column.description: Concatenation of application name and object internal unique ID from central Base

column.name: user_name
column.description: The author of the exclusion request

column.name: comment
column.description: Comment describing the reason of the exclusion

column.name: exclusion_date
column.description: Date of exclusion creation (date of most recent violations), violations are excluded after this date

column.name: exclusion_snapshot_id
column.description: Reference of the snapshot at exclusion date, violations are excluded after this snapshot
